climbs.name: [Redacted]
climbs.fa: Dave Jones, Darlene Anderson, Jessica Shintani

content.description:
Pretty much all the same as White Knuckle Express to the left.

To the right of White Knuckle Express.
7 bolts. It used to be in the guidebook as "sport+", as there was a bit of a run out in the middle. The new book doesn't mention this so it may or may not have had a bolt added. Maybe bring some gear if 5.8 is your limit.

A heavily featured and occasionally awkward climb up the left-hand side of the Grassy Glades wall. Follow cracks and face holds over a small roof to start.  Continue up, trending slightly right, past some greenery to a bolt or three on/near the arete. Continue up the obvious line to the top.

Leftmost climb on Grassy Glades. Roughly follows ropeline in photo.
Mixed gear and bolts, with some tricky placements. It's a good puzzle on lead.  Bolt anchor at the top.

climbs.name: Brilliant Pebbles
climbs.fa: Dave Jones, Jim Sibley, Helen Habgood 1993

content.description:
A burly 10c, sustained the whole way up, wanders a bit so keep your mind open to stepping right or left rather than always straight up.

First line of bolts on the left (south) side of the wall.
9 bolts.

This wall's namesake, Grassy Glades, follows a wonderfully diverse crack system nearly from bottom to top. Some thin sections, including early on, make it a little heady at times. Very enjoyable.

The standout crack system on this wall, Grassy Glades is easily spotted to the left of the bulge.  Bolt anchors.
Pro is interesting, varied, and usually there when you want it.

Crux is off the bottom and then it's great fun to the top.

To the right (north) of the large bulge, starts on a smaller bulge.  The bolts that go up the big bulge are the 11a and it's to the right of that.
7 bolts. It used to be in the guidebook as "sport+", as there was a bit of a run out in the middle. The new book doesn't mention this so it may or may not have had a bolt added. Maybe bring some gear if 10a is your limit.

Fun, thin face climbing, with the crux coming on the overhang before the high first bolt.  Rests are solid and frequent enough to make this an accessible first route at the grade.  As you approach the top, your thinking cap might be more valuable than your brainbucket.

Begins underneath the right side of the obvious bulge on Grassy Glades wall.  Look for the bolt line, and follow it. Or don't?
10 bolts.

A great warm up. If you're comfortable with 5.8 then it'll feel a little bit run out but nothing too serious.

To the right of Short Claim Jumpers.
7 bolts. It used to be in the guidebook as "sport+", as there was a bit of a run out in the middle. The new book doesn't mention this so it may or may not have had a bolt added. Maybe bring some gear if 5.8 is your limit.

Grassy Glades is a west-facing wall with some great 8-11a climbs. It's a worthwhile stop on your way to Morning Glory or for something easier before tackling Great White. Generally crowded on weekends. Its routes have either chains or rap rings at the top of the climbs.
